page.title: And Then There Was One (1994 film)

revision.text:
{{Infobox television | show_name = And Then There Was One | image = And Then There was One 1994 TV Film DVD Cover.jpg | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = DVD cover | genre = Drama | creator = | based_on = | writer = Rama Laurie Stagner | screenplay = | story = | director = [[David Jones (director)|David Jones]] | starring = [[Amy Madigan]]
[[Dennis Boutsikaris]] | narrated = | theme_music_composer = [[J.A.C. Redford]] | country = United States | language = English | num_episodes = | producer = Angela Bromstad
Julian Marks (supervising producer)
Freyda Rothstein (executive producer)
Rama Laurie Stagner (co-producer)
Roxy Ventola (co-producer) | editor = Pamela Malouf | cinematography = | runtime = 87 minutes | company = | distributor = | budget = | network = [[Lifetime Television]] | first_aired = {{Film date|1994|03|09}} | last_aired = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | website = }} '''''And Then There was One''''' is a 1994 television film starring [[Amy Madigan]] and [[Dennis Boutsikaris]]. It was directed by [[David Jones (director)|David Jones]]. The film first aired on the [[Lifetime Television]] network on March 9, 1994.[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109115/releaseinfo?ref_=tt_dt_dt ''And Then There was One'' profile], imdb.com; accessed December 13, 2014. ==Background== The film stars Amy Madigan as Roxy Ventola, Dennis Boutsikaris as Vinnie Ventola, and Jane Daly as Lorrie. Other cast members in the film include [[Jennifer Hetrick]] as Janet, [[Martha Henry]] as Dr. Moore, and [[Kenneth Welsh]] as David Burns.[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109115/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ov_st_sm#cast ''And Then There was One'' cast credits], imdb.com; accessed December 13, 2014. The film's production companies were Freyda Rothstein Productions and [[Hearst Entertainment Productions]].[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109115/companycredits?ref_=tt_dt_co ''And Then There was One'' company credits], imdb.com; accessed December 13, 2014. Based on real events, the film follows the story of two Los Angeles-based screenwriters who had attended a fertility clinic in order to conceive a child, before HIV testing became routine. The couple's implant was successful, but the family discovered they had the AIDS virus. Vinnie Ventola died in 1991, and the baby Miranda died of the disease only a day later.{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ELFdW-nWJIUC&pg=PA130&lpg=PA130&dq=roxy+and+vinnie+ventola&source=bl&ots=SyQlQc_0r_&sig=sE_OqfaSpzlqyFD43LUOIXJSKQs&hl=en&sa=X&ei=15uKUbO2O-2M0wXWyYHADw&ved=0CDoQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=roxy%20and%20vinnie%20ventola&f=false|title=Stealing dreams: a fertility clinic scandal - Mary Dodge, Gilbert Geis - Google Books|publisher=Books.google.co.uk|accessdate=2013-05-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.lightandlife.us/ventolabio|title=Vincent Ventola bio|publisher=Lightandlife.us|date=1948-05-26|accessdate=2013-05-08}} Roxy Ventola was a co-producer of ''And Then There was One'' and she remarried in 1993, to AIDS activist Matthew McGrath, before dying from AIDS on November 14, 1994. She had become an activist herself and a successful advocate for peer counseling and peer support programs. She was president of the Board of Women at Risk, a support service for women with HIV/AIDS; a co-founding member of Women Alive, a peer group run by and for women volunteers with HIV/AIDS; a founding member of Friends for Life, a support service for heterosexuals with HIV/AIDS; and an active member of ACT UP/LA. Her play, ''After the Bomb'', which was about a post-AIDS world, was produced in the spring of 1994, at Open Fist Theater in Los Angeles. She performed in the Michael Kerns play, "AIDS, US Women: Silent NO More."{{cite web|author=Nancy MacNeil|url=http://www.thebody.com/content/art79.html|title=A Memorial To A Friend: Roxy Ventola McGrath|publisher=TheBody.com|accessdate=2013-05-08}} Madigan was the winner of the CableACE award for "Actress in a Movie or Miniseries" for her performance in ''And Then There was One''.[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109115/awards?ref_=tt_awd ''And Then There was One''], imdb.com; accessed December 13, 2014. In her acceptance speech she gave tribute to the Ventola family and mentioned that Roxy had since died. ==Release== In America, the film was issued on DVD via Lifetime Television as part of "The True Stories Collection" series.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/True-Stories-Collection-Then-There/dp/B000784WW2/ref=sr_1_2?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1368039286&sr=1-2&keywords=and+then+there+was+one|title=The True Stories Collection: And Then There Was One|publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=2013-05-08}} In recent years, Fisher Klingenstein Films issued the film on Amazon Video. In the UK, the film was released on VHS and DVD. It was issued in 1997 on VHS via Odyssey as part of "The Weepie Collection" series, whilst another Odyseey VHS edition was also issued in 2001.,{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/then-there-was-one-Madigan/dp/B001S8355A/ref=sr_1_3?s=dvd&ie=UTF8&qid=1368039012&sr=1-3&keywords=and+then+there+was+one|title=And then there was one - Amy Madigan ,Kenneth Welsh/true story: Amazon.co.uk: Film & TV|publisher=Amazon.co.uk|accessdate=2013-05-08}} It was released onto DVD in July 2008 by Infinity Media.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Then-There-Was-One-DVD/dp/B001TX1JAM/ref=sr_1_1?s=dvd&ie=UTF8&qid=1368039012&sr=1-1&keywords=and+then+there+was+one|title=And Then There Was One|publisher=Amazon.co.uk|accessdate=2013-05-08}} It was issued as a true story double film set alongside the 2002 film ''[[Crossing the Line (2002 film)|Crossing the Line]]'', starring [[Terry Farrell (actress)|Terry Farrell]].{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Crossing-Line-Then-There-Was/dp/B000VNMQC6/ref=sr_1_2?s=dvd&ie=UTF8&qid=1368039810&sr=1-2&keywords=and+then+there+was+one|title=Crossing The Line/And Then There Was One DVD: Amazon.co.uk: Film & TV|publisher=Amazon.co.uk|accessdate=2013-05-08}} ==Plot== Roxy and Vinnie Ventola are a successful television screenwriting couple, who are struggling to conceive a child. Aside from that the couple have the perfect, happy marriage. After years of fertility treatments, the couple manage to conceive a daughter, Miranda, who falls ill with what is at first believed to be the flu, and then pneumonia. However, the underlying cause is soon revealed when the couple learn that their newborn has AIDS. Soon afterward, the two parents are also diagnosed with the virus. The film follows the family as they struggle to deal with the social, spiritual and physical tolls that the disease exacts on its sufferers.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmovie.com/movie/and-then-there-was-one-v149373|title=And Then There Was One (1994) - Trailers, Reviews, Synopsis, Showtimes and Cast|publisher=AllMovie|accessdate=2013-05-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dvdverdict.com/reviews/andthentherewasone.php|title=DVD Verdict Review - And Then There Was One|publisher=Dvdverdict.com|date=2005-09-30|accessdate=2013-05-08}} ==Cast== * [[Amy Madigan]] as Roxy Ventola * [[Dennis Boutsikaris]] as Vinnie Ventola * Jane Daly as Lorrie * [[Jennifer Hetrick]] as Janet * [[Martha Henry]] as Dr. Moore * [[Kenneth Welsh]] as David Burns * [[Richard Monette]] as Dr. Lloyd * Dawn Greenhalgh as Julia Sands * Henry Ramer as Roxy's dad * [[Pam Hyatt]] as Roxy's mom * [[Tabitha St. Germain]] as ICU nurse * [[Naz Edwards]] as Maternity nurse * [[Nancy Anne Sakovich]] as Lena Burns * [[Corey Sevier]] as Grim Reaper ==Reception== Bernadette McCallion of [[AllMovie]] gave the film two and a half stars out of five and called the film a "heart-wrenching made-for-cable drama". Diane Wild of [[DVD Verdict]] reviewed the film in 2005. She felt the film lost its "emotional effect because we don't get to know these characters as real people". She added: "The filmmakers may have thought the story was compelling enough on its own, but without the help of well-developed characters, it feels oddly jarring. Criticizing this well-meaning film feels like kicking a puppy - a sick puppy - but it's not a particularly entertaining hour and a half, when what should be a heart wrenching story is undermined by a script that treats its protagonists as saints instead of people. Unfortunately ''And Then There was One'' is too dated and simplistic to bring anything meaningful to the AIDS on film canon, and it doesn't manage to be a compelling drama outside of the real-life tragedy of the disease itself." ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|0109115}} {{David Jones}} [[Category:1994 television films]] [[Category:1990s drama films]] [[Category:American drama films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films based on actual events]] [[Category:Films directed by David Jones]] [[Category:HIV/AIDS in film]] [[Category:Lifetime (TV network) films]]

Afrikaans | budget = | gross = }} '''''Angus Buchan's Ordinary People''''' is a 2012 [[South Africa]]n drama film that tells the story of South African [[preacher]] [[Angus Buchan]] and the intertwining stories of three men en route to one of Buchan's [[Mighty Men's Conference]]s. It is not a sequel to the film ''[[Faith Like Potatoes]],'' also based on the life story of Angus Buchan.{{cite web | title = Angus Buchan Filming New Movie | url = http://www.channel24.co.za/Movies/News/Angus-Buchan-starts-filming-new-movie-20110412}} The film was directed by FC Hamman and stars Anton Dekker, Jaco Muller, Lucky Koza, [[David James (South African actor)|David James]], Kate Normington, Robin Smith and Norman Anstey. Buchan makes a brief appearance as himself.{{cite web|title=Angus Buchan's Ordinary People Opens April 5 |url=http://gatewaynews.co.za/2012/02/17/angus-buchans-ordinary-people-movie-opens-in-sa-on-april-5/ |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120504162122/http://gatewaynews.co.za/2012/02/17/angus-buchans-ordinary-people-movie-opens-in-sa-on-april-5/ |archivedate=4 May 2012 }} ==Plot== The film opens with Angus Buchan's story as he realizes from the time he is a teen that he wants to be a preacher, and is discouraged when his minister tells him about the years of schooling he must complete. He goes on to acquire a farm and eventually marry, and while he works hard to make a success of his land, he never abandons his dream. He begins by preaching to the maize in his field from the back of his truck, and this grows into his audience of thousands at his Mighty Men's Conferences. The story then shifts to three interwoven stories, based on real characters and real events. Lucky Nzimande (Lucky Koza) is a career criminal who unwittingly attempts to hijack what turns out to be two policemen on their way to the Mighty Men's Conference. After his gun fails to fire on Lucky, one of the policemen takes this as a sign from God that he is meant to take the man to the Conference with them. They handcuff Lucky in the back and ask him about his story; he talks about never knowing his father and his mother dying when he was 8. He started stealing early on to help provide for his siblings and grandmother, who died when he was 13. Lucky escapes from the policemen and is assaulted that night, suffering a gash on his head. The next day the men see him and kindly offer to tend to his wound and give him a ride home. Afterwards he agrees to go to the Conference with them. André Cloete (Jaco Muller) is an alcoholic young adult who is self-destructing quickly due in part to his emotionally absent but strictly religious father. His mother covers for him when he crashes his car into a neighbor's gate, begging her not to call the police. After another severe accident his father prays over him and realizes he is too harsh, but Andre continues to drink and party after getting out of the hospital. He then finally agrees to attend the Conference with his father and brother. John Peters (Anton Dekker) is a middle-aged [[panel beater]] and biker with two sons. He marries a woman named Marlene and she and her two girls move in with them. Marlene's brother-in-law Danny (David James) asks John for a business loan; John doesn't have the money but agrees to stand surety if Danny applies for a bank loan. John's youngest son then dies in a motorcycle accident, Danny defaults on the loan and John is diagnosed with a chronic lung condition. Sensing he is taking his anger out on his oldest son, Marlene encourages him to attend the Conference. John reconciles with Danny and apologizes to his son before he goes. The men all make their way to a Mighty Men's Conference where they listen to Buchan's preaching, which includes his recounting of the two heart attacks he suffered the year before. After the Conference, Lucky returns to his impoverished hometown and begins passing out religious flyers. Andre calls a friend and tells him that he's given his life to the Lord. John suffers an accident on the way home and dies. After his funeral, Danny is seen off to himself, crying and praying. The film ends with titles revealing that Lucky continues to preach, Andre does volunteer work, and John's oldest son Gavin took over his business and continues to care for Marlene and her girls.{{cite web | title = New Angus Buchan Film Starts Shooting | url = http://www.screenafrica.com/page/news/industry/420877-New-Angus-Buchan-film-starts-shooting}} ==Cast== [[File:Angus Buchan, Mighty Men, 2010, b.jpg|thumb|right|Noted South African preacher Angus Buchan appears as himself in the film.]] [[File:DavidJamesFacesofHope.jpg|thumb|right|Veteran South African actor [[David James (South African actor)|David James]] appears as Danny Boy.]] * Anton Dekker as John Peters. * Jaco Muller as Andre Cloete. * Lucky Koza as Lucky Nzimande. * [[David James (South African actor)|David James]] as Danny Boy. * Anrich Herbst as young Angus Buchan. * [[Angus Buchan]] as himself. * Norman Antsey as James Cloete. * Kate Normington as Ellen Cloete. * Robin Smith as Herman Visser. * Hannes Muller as Ben Wolhuter. * Charles Bouguenon as Xavier. * Michelle Douglas as Marlene. * Simeon Hamman as Juan. * Steve Larter as Terrence. * Kaz McFadden as Jake Cloete. ==Production== The movie was produced by Andre Scholtz, Jarrod de Jong, FC Hamman and Peter Scott; it was directed by FC Hamman. It is distributed by Ster-Kinekor Distribution in South Africa. Filming took place in [[Johannesburg]], [[Cape Town]], Limpopo and Greytown, and the film includes live footage of one of Buchan's Mighty Men's Conferences as held on his Shalom Farms. It also employed hundreds of extras for scenes of Buchan's preaching.{{cite web|title=FC Hamman Films |url=http://www.fchammanfilms.co.za/news/show/angus-buchans-ordinary-people-feature-film-drama--12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111104211757/http://www.fchammanfilms.co.za/news/show/angus-buchans-ordinary-people-feature-film-drama--12 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2011-11-04 }}{{cite web | title = The Witness | url = http://www.witness.co.za/index.php?showcontent&global%5B_id%5D=60206}} ===Direction=== According to Buchan, director FC Hamman, who had directed the official documentary for the World Cup in South Africa, approached him after a Mighty Men's Conference in 2010. "He told me he wanted to do something for God ... He said he wanted to make a movie about what happened to men at the conference."{{cite web | title = Angus Buchan’s extraordinary life | url = http://www.iol.co.za/tonight/news/local/angus-buchan-s-extraordinary-life-1.1271078}} ===Score=== The original score was provided by South African composer and musician Mauritz Lotz, and music by international Christian recording artist [[Michael W. Smith]]. ==Reception== The film received positive to mixed reviews from critics. Tina George of ''IOL Tonight'' gave it 4 stars out of 5, stating, "Director Hamman does a superb job in captivating the audience with these real-life scenarios."{{cite web | title = MOVIE REVIEW: Ordinary People | url = http://www.iol.co.za/tonight/movies/movie-review-ordinary-people-1.1271082}} Philip Altebeker of ''Business Day'' stated, "Ordinary People is filled with motor accidents and Hamman’s overuse of this device — literally, a deus ex machine — detracts from the intended message which, to his credit, is otherwise treated discreetly if not completely convincingly despite having its heart in the right place."{{cite web | title = Philip Altebeker: Film | url = http://www.businessday.co.za/articles/Content.aspx?id=169142}} According to ''Screen Africa'', the movie opened at the number six spot in the local box office.{{cite web | title = Ordinary People’s big box office | url = http://www.screenafrica.com/page/news/business/1228483-Ordinary-Peoples-big-box-office}} ==See also== ''[[Faith Like Potatoes]]''
[[Mighty Men's Conference]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|2255735}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120221223925/http://www.ordinarypeoplethemovie.co.za/ ''Angus Buchan's Ordinary People'' official movie website] * [https://www.facebook.com/pages/Angus-Buchan/257406448855 Angus Buchan on Facebook] [[Category:2012 films]] [[Category:South African films]] [[Category:Films shot in South Africa]] [[Category:Films set in South Africa]] [[Category:Films based on actual events]] [[Category:Films by South African directors]]

revision.text: {{Infobox Website | name = Bonsai Kitten | logo = | url = http://bonsaikitten.com [Down as of April 15, 2016.] ding.net/bonsaikitten (mirror archive) | alexa = {{DecreasePositive}} 610,307 ({{as of|2014|4|1|alt=April 2014}}){{cite web|url= https://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/bonsaikitten.com |title= Bonsaikitten.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2014-04-01 }} | type = Hoax website | commercial = No | registration = None needed | owner = Dr. Michael Wong Chang | author = Dr. Michael Wong Chang | launch date = 2000-12-22 | current status = Offline, redirects to fake retailer sites }} '''Bonsai Kitten''' was a [[hoax]] website that claimed to provide instructions on how to grow a kitten in a jar, so as to mold the bones of the kitten into the shape of the jar as the cat grows, much like how a [[bonsai]] plant is shaped. It was made by an [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology|MIT]] university student going by the [[Pseudonym|alias]] of Dr. Michael Wong Chang.{{cite web|author=Declan McCullagh|date=9 February 2001|url=https://www.wired.com/politics/law/news/2001/02/41733|title=FBI Goes After BonsaiKitten.com |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317000000/http://www.wired.com/politics/law/news/2001/02/41733 |archivedate=17 March 2014|publisher=[[Wired News]] }} The website generated furor after members of the [[General public|public]] complained to [[animal rights]] organizations. The Michigan Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (MSPCA) stated that "while the site's content may be faked, the issue it is campaigning for may create [[Animal abuse|violence towards animals]]". Although the website was shut down some time ago, [[petitions]] are still circulated to shut down the site or complain to its [[internet service provider|ISP]]. The website has been debunked by several organizations including [[snopes.com]] and [[the Humane Society of the United States]]. ==Start of the website== On October 30, 2000, BonsaiKitten.com was featured as a "Cruel Site of the Day" on the website Cruel.com. When this attracted complaints, Cruel.com removed its links to BonsaiKitten.com. Afterwards, however, when links to the BonsaiKitten.com website then spread across the world, many concerned animal lovers sent complaints to the [[Animal Welfare Institute]] and the [[Humane Society of the United States]]. Animal welfare groups made statements saying that Bonsai Kittens were not real. The URL drew criticism, which caused the initial host, MIT, to remove it. ==Description of the spoof== [[File:Square watermelon.jpg|thumb|[[Square watermelon]]. The square watermelon was later said by the site creator to be influential in the creation of BonsaiKitten.com. (Square watermelons are grown in jars so as to form a square shape.)]] BonsaiKitten.com's pictures show kittens in jars, presented as real examples of the "lost art" as described on the Bonsai Kitten web page. The spoof, according to "Dr. Chang", is that the world increasingly sees nature as a commodity, so such a site may well be in demand. The spoof came to large-scale attention as The Cruel Site of the Day for December 22, 2000, and was continually heavily condemned by animal rights organizations, and after hundreds of people complained daily to them, they stated that even if Bonsai Kitten was a spoof it "encourages animal cruelty".{{cite web|author=Jennifer Jacobson |date=21 January 2001|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080211191919/http://chronicle.com/free/2001/02/2001022101t.htm|url=http://chronicle.com/free/2001/02/2001022101t.htm|title=Created at MIT, a 'Bonsai Kitten' Website Stirs Animal Lovers' Passions|publisher=[[The Chronicle of Higher Education|The Chronicle]]|archivedate=11 February 2008}}{{cite web|author=Joe Salkowski|date=19 February 2001|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050310213313/http://dispatches.azstarnet.com/joe/2001/0219-982430241.htm|title=Animal Lovers Aren't Laughing at kitty-contorting web spoof|publisher=Dispatches Ground Zero|url=http://dispatches.azstarnet.com/joe/2001/0219-982430241.htm|archivedate=10 March 2005}} The webpage being featured on the cruel.com website was significantly controversial and it was quickly removed. Initial humane society statements decrying the website as "encouraging abuse" caused local investigation, along with an [[FBI]] announcement that it was to investigate the [[hoax]]. The prosecution of the site by the FBI was welcomed by animal activists, but decried by web authorities. The FBI backed up its investigating of Bonsai Kitten by using a law signed by President Bill Clinton in 1999. The attacking of the BonsaiKitten.com website had the effect of displacing the website, which found a new ISP two more times, before being permanently hosted on [[Rotten.com]] servers. Because the website is still kept on some mirrors, it continues{{update after|2011|11|26}} to receive complaints from animal activists.{{cite news|author=Linda Fuoco|date=8 August 2001|title= Pet Tales - Monthly Column|publisher=Pittsburgh Post Gazette|quote=The Allegheny County district attorney's office launched an investigation after receiving complaints about Bonsai Kitten. Within minutes investigators learned the kitties were a hoax.}}{{cite web|author=Janelle Brown|year=2001|url=http://www.salon.com/2001/03/05/rotten_2/ |title=The Internet's Public Enema No.1|publisher=[[Salon.com|Salon]]|access-date=30 October 2010}}{{Cite news |last=Smith |first=Andrew |date= 10 February 2001 |url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2001/02/10/fbi_goes_bonsai_kitten_hunting/ |title=FBI goes Bonsai Kitten hunting |work=[[The Register]]}} The furor over the site triggered by animal rights organizations has been offset by their continued statements that the site itself is a fake. They have been stating this since 2001.{{Cite news |author=Theo Emery |date=2001-02-22 |title=Animal Lovers Not Laughing at about joke Internet site "Bonsai Kitten" |work=[[Associated Press]] }} ===Controversy post-2000=== Since 2000, groups such as the [[Animal Welfare Institute]] and The Humane Society of the United States have received hundreds of complaints. Animal welfare groups declared the site as fake but stated they did believe it was potentially harmful. Other animal rights groups have stated that the site creates an atmosphere of cruelty to animals. There is no evidence to date that the site is anything more than satire. Numerous authorities have advised people to stop sending complaint forms via [[email]]. The original bonsaikitten.com is [[mirror website|mirrored]] by many sites today. The nature and presentation of the sites content is such that many [[animal rights activist]]s still take issue with the context of the website. Bonsai Kitten has been further updated from other servers, but infrequently and slowly, with recent additions to the site being research indicating that kitty litter causes [[brain damage]]. The website states that this enhances the Bonsai Kitten art form's practical value.[http://www.snopes.com/critters/crusader/bonsai.asp Bonsai Kitten]. Snopes. Retrieved 2010-10-30. ===History of the controversy=== The controversy started soon after the creation of the BonsaiKitten.com website. It has continued since and has been the object of numerous spam email pleas. These pleas rely on the audiences, often not knowing English, to spread them. Consequently, these petitions are often spread via the Internet in non-English-speaking countries. Blues News also provided a link, which was shortly thereafter removed from the site, as complaints against the website's existence and its content began to surface.{{Cite news |last=Smith |first=Andrew |date= 26 January 2001 |url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2001/01/26/bonsai_kitten_craze_sweeps_online/ |title=Bonsai Kitten craze sweeps online world |work=[[The Register]]}} ==See also== {{Portal|Internet|2000s}} * [[Chain letter]] * [[Comprachicos]] * [[Foot binding]] * [[Impossible bottle]] * [[ManBeef.com]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.snopes.com/critters/crusader/bonsai.asp Bonsai Kittens - Snopes.com Urban Legends Reference Pages] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070406052143/http://dir.yahoo.com/Society_and_Culture/Mythology_and_Folklore/Folklore/Urban_Legends/Bonsai_Kitten/ Yahoo Directory Urban Legends > Bonsai Kitten] [[Category:Internet memes]] [[Category:Entertainment websites]] [[Category:Internet hoaxes]] [[Category:Humorous hoaxes in science]] [[Category:Fiction about animal cruelty]] [[Category:Urban legends]] [[Category:Fictional companies]] [[Category:Fictional cats]] [[Category:Satirical websites]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2000]] [[Category:2000 hoaxes]] [[Category:Cats in popular culture]] [[Category:Shock sites]]

The '''Bowdoin Square Theatre''' (est.1892) in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], was a [[Theater (structure)|playhouse]] and cinema. It was located on [[Bowdoin Square (Boston)|Bowdoin Square]] in the [[West End, Boston|West End]],<ref>Boston Almanac, 1893-1894. Boston Register and Business Directory, 1918</ref> in a building designed by architect [[Clarence Blackall|C.H. Blackall]].<ref>"Shaping the Temple: progress and particulars of the work being done at the new Bowdoin Square house of amusement." Boston Daily Globe, November 12, 1891</ref> Personnel included Charles F. Atkinson<ref>Atherton Brownell. Boston Theatres of To-Day. The Bostonian, v.2, no.6, 1896</ref> and William Harris.<ref>Boston Daily Globe, March 13, 1892</ref> Audience members included future magician Julius Linsky<ref>Boston Globe, 07 Oct 1982</ref> and future actor Joseph Sicari<ref>Blowen, Michael. West End taught him `You Gotta Have Heart.' Boston Globe, 05 Feb 1996</ref>

{{Infobox album | name = Concerto, One Night in Central Park | type = live | longtype = (with DVD) | artist = [[Andrea Bocelli]] | cover = Bocelli Concerto Central Park.jpeg | alt = | released = November 15, 2011<ref name="Decca">[http://deccarecords.com/artist/releases/release.aspx?pid=64235&aid=108 Official Decca website] [[Decca Records]]</ref> | recorded = [[Central Park]], New York City September 15, 2011 | venue = | studio = | genre = {{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[classical music|classical]]}} | length = | label = [[Decca Records|Decca]],<ref name="Decca"/> [[Sugar Records|Sugar]],<ref>[http://www.sugarmusic.com/it/discografia/album/?aid=355 Bocelli album discography] [[Sugar Records]]</ref> [[Universal Music Group|Universal]] | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Andrea Bocelli]] [[album]] | type = album | prev_title = [[Notte Illuminata]] | prev_year = 2011 | title = Concerto: One Night in Central Park | year = 2011 | next_title = [[iTunes Festival: London 2012 (Andrea Bocelli EP)|iTunes Festival: London 2012]] | next_year = 2012 }} {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Andrea Bocelli]] [[DVD-Video|DVD]] | type = video | prev_title = [[My Christmas Special]] | prev_year = 2009 | title = Live in Central Park | year = 2011 | next_title = | next_year = }} }}
'''''Concerto: One Night in Central Park''''' is a [[live album]] by Italian [[tenor]] [[Andrea Bocelli]].<ref>[http://www.theatermania.com/new-york/news/10-2011/andrea-bocelli-concerto-one-night-in-central-park_43001.html Andrea Bocelli Concerto: One Night In Central Park CD & DVD Set for November 15 Release]</ref>
The album was recorded September 15, 2011, during a concert at the [[Central Park]]'s [[Great Lawn and Turtle Pond|Great Lawn]], in New York City. Guest performers included [[Celine Dion]], [[Tony Bennett]], [[Chris Botti]], [[Bryn Terfel]], [[Pretty Yende]], and music producer [[David Foster]].<ref name="Central Park Guests"/>
PBS Announced that it would broadcast the concert nationwide, as ''Andrea Bocelli Live in Central Park''.<ref>[https://www.pbs.org/about/news/archive/2011/andrea-bocelli-arts/ PBS Announces Andrea Bocelli Live in Central Park, The Tenor’s Free Concert With New York Philharmonic and Special Guests] [[PBS]].org</ref>
The album, immediately upon release, entered the Billboard Top 10 and peaked at No. 4 on the [[Billboard 200|Billboard ''200'']].<ref name="Billboard 200"/>
==Background== It was announced that Bocelli will give a free concert sponsored by [[Barilla Group|Barilla]], in September, on the [[Great Lawn and Turtle Pond|Great Lawn]] of [[Central Park]] in New York City.<ref name="Concert Announcement">[http://bocellicentralpark.com/news/detail/andrea_bocelli_gifts_new_york_city_with_a_once_in_a_lifetime_musical Andrea Bocelli Gifts New York City With A Once In A Lifetime Musical] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120402000000/http://bocellicentralpark.com/news/detail/andrea_bocelli_gifts_new_york_city_with_a_once_in_a_lifetime_musical |date=April 2, 2012 }}</ref> [[Image:Bocelli Concert Central Park Poster.jpeg|200px|thumb|left|Central Park Concert Poster]] After the announcement Bocelli declared that, "I cannot help but smile when thinking about the upcoming concert in Central Park. It was my father's dream, and my father was right, because my artistic path would have been entirely different without the strong and sincere embrace of this extraordinary city where everything is possible, even when it seems impossible." Bocelli continues, "My father will not be there, but I can count on his blessing and his kind and gentle smile to give me courage. My mother, sitting in the front row, will feel my father too, and they will be together again just like when I was a little boy performing on the fireplace steps. Perhaps they had secretly dreamed that I might have the opportunity to perform in New York City, and maybe right here in Central Park."<ref name="Concert Announcement"/>
[[Mayor of New York City|New York City Mayor]] [[Michael Bloomberg]] said, "The Great Lawn in Central Park is one of the most remarkable and beautiful outdoor venues in the world and it is a great pleasure to welcome Andrea Bocelli back to New York to perform there. This free concert will be a memorable cultural moment for the thousands of New Yorkers and visitors that will watch the event live in the park, and many, many more through the broadcast by [[WNET]]."<ref name="Concert Announcement"/>
[[New York City Department of Parks and Recreation|New York City Parks]] Commissioner Adrian Benepe said, "I join the Mayor and all New Yorkers in thanking Andrea Bocelli and all involved in making a beautiful autumn evening full of splendor and world-class music possible, in one of the most cherished outdoor places in New York City. From the Great Lawn in the heart of [[Manhattan]] to the [[Great Performances]] series on WNET, where millions more will be able to share this gift, it will be a very special occasion. A million thank yous. Grazie mille!"<ref name="Concert Announcement"/>
During the concert that took place September 15, during a rainy day, Bocelli was accompanied by the [[New York Philharmonic]], conducted by its music director [[Alan Gilbert (conductor)|Alan Gilbert]], and the [[Westminster Choir College|Westminster Symphonic Choir]].<ref name="Central Park Guests">[http://bocellicentralpark.com/news/detail/celine_dion_tony_bennett Céline Dion, Tony Bennett Among Those To Celebrate With Andrea Bocelli On Central Park’s Great Lawn] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120402132620/http://bocellicentralpark.com/news/detail/celine_dion_tony_bennett |date=April 2, 2012 }}</ref> He was also joined on stage by singers [[Celine Dion]], [[Tony Bennett]], [[Bryn Terfel]], [[Ana María Martínez]] and [[Pretty Yende]], instrumentalists [[Chris Botti]], [[Andrea Griminelli]] and [[Nicola Benedetti]], and producer [[David Foster]].<ref name="Central Park Guests"/>
The concert took place September 15, and was attended by 70,000 people, including [[Michael Bloomberg|Mayor Bloomberg]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]] and [[Donald Trump]].<ref>[http://www.showbiz411.com/2011/09/16/trumps-trump-each-other-at-andrea-bocelli-central-park-concert Trumps Trump Each Other at Andrea Bocelli Central Park Concert]</ref><ref>[http://www.nypost.com/p/pagesix/trump_family_reunion_sZA7WMx4T9Er1MNF38mcfI?CMP=OTC-rss&FEEDNAME= Trump family reunion], [[New York Post]] September 18, 2011 article.</ref>
==Release and promotion== Tickets for the concert at [[Central Park]] were made available August 4, 2011, following Bocelli's performance on ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today]]'', and the 60,000 tickets were sold out within the next few hours.<ref>[http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/culturemonster/2011/08/andrea-bocelli-central-park.htm Andrea Bocelli's Central Park concert is a sell out] [[Los Angeles Times]]</ref> The CD and DVD were released in over 70 countries,<ref>[http://www.andreabocellifoundation.org/?page_id=137 Andrea Bocelli Biography - A record-breaking artist] [[Andrea Bocelli]] Foundation Official website.</ref> on November 15, 2011.<ref name="Decca"/>
In November he performed "More" at the [[Alan Titchmarsh Show]] in the United Kingdom, and ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' in the United States,<ref name="USA Promotion">[https://finance.yahoo.com/news/Beloved-Tenor-Andrea-Bocelli-prnews-3247284898.html?x=0&.v=1 Beloved Tenor Andrea Bocelli Set for National TV Appearances in Support of Andrea Bocelli Concerto: One Night in Central Park] [[Yahoo! Finance]]</ref><ref>[http://www.baltimoresun.com/entertainment/bthesite/tv-lust/bal-dancing-with-the-stars-week-8-results-20111108,0,346316.story 'Dancing with the Stars' week 8 results]</ref> and "[[Amazing Grace]]" on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]''.<ref name="USA Promotion"/>
Bocelli later made television appearances include [[BBC Breakfast]] and the televised concert, Children in need, at the [[MEN Arena]], in [[Manchester]],<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/pudsey/news/news041111.shtml Andrea Bocelli, Jessie J, Jamie Cullum and Kelly Rowland join BBC Children in Need Rocks Manchester] [[BBC]]</ref> in the UK, and [[Good Morning America]] and [[The Talk (U.S. TV series)|The Talk]], in the States, which aired in December.<ref name="USA Promotion"/>
Bocelli gave 5 concerts in the United States in December. In the meantime, the concert at Central Park, hosted by American journalist [[Paula Zahn]], was airing throughout the United States and Canada, by [[PBS]], on [[WNET|THIRTEEN]]'s [[Great Performances]] series, and in Italy, by [[Rai 2]] and [[Sky Uno]].<ref name="USA Promotion"/>
In February 2012, Bocelli gave three Valentine concerts, including one at the [[Amway Center]] in Orlando Florida, setting the all time ticket sales record by besting the previous record set by pop singer [[Lady Gaga]].<ref>[http://www.wftv.com/news/entertainment/music/bocelli-sets-amway-center-ticket-sales-record/nHdJ9 Bocelli Sets Amway Center Ticket Sales Record]</ref>
In November and December 2012, he returned to the States to perform in 6 concerts.

==Commercial performance== ''Concerto: One Night in Central Park'' entered the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] at No. 4 with 87,000 copies sold, becoming Bocelli's sixth top 10 effort, while ''[[My Christmas]]'', his 2009 album, climbed from No. 62 to 36, with 17,000 copies sold, up 83% from the previous week.<ref name="Billboard 200">[http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/464995/drakes-take-care-blasts-onto-billboard-200 Drake's 'Take Care' Blasts Onto Billboard 200] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> On its second week, the album fell to No. 14, with nearly 65,000 copies sold, down 25%, while ''My Christmas'' fell to No. 50, with 23,000. copies. On its third week, ''Concerto'' returned to the top 10, jumping to No. 8, with 61,000 copies, down 6%,<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/42273/michael-bubles-christmas-jingles-at-no-1-for-second-week Michael Buble's 'Christmas' Jingles At No. 1 for Second Week] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> while ''My Christmas'' rebounded to No. 17 with 35,000 copies sold, making Bocelli the only artist with two albums in the top 20 that week.<ref>[http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1675515/billboard-album-charts-michael-buble-justin-bieber.jhtml Michael Buble's Christmas Tops Billboard Again] [[MTV]]</ref> The following week, ''Concerto'' jumped two spots to No. 6, with 79,000 copies sold, up 14%,<ref>[http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1675957/michael-buble-christmas-billboard.jhtml Michael Buble Holds On To 1 Billboard Slot] [[MTV]]</ref><ref>[http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/41927/michael-bubles-christmas-stays-atop-billboard-200-black-keys-hit-no-2 Michael Buble's 'Christmas' Stays Atop Billboard 200, Black Keys Hit No. 2] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> while Bocelli continued to be the only artist with two albums in the top 20 for a second consecutive week, as ''My Christmas'' also rose to No. 16, with 49,000 copies sold.<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/charts/2011-12-24/billboard-200 Billboard 200 - 2011-12-24] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> In its fifth week of release the album sold 76,000 more copies, down 3%, sliding just two positions to No. 8 on the chart,<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/41610/michael-bubles-christmas-hits-fourth-week-at-no-1 Michael Buble's 'Christmas' Hits Fourth Week at No. 1] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> while my Christmas fell to No. 19, with 48,000 copies sold, giving Bocelli yet another week with 2 albums in the Top 20. On its sixth week of release, the live album dropped to No. 13,<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/charts/2012-01-07/billboard-200 Billboard 200 - 2012-01-07 (No. 1-20)]''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> while the Christmas album dropped to No. 36,<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/charts/2012-01-07/billboard-200?begin=21&order=position Billboard 200 - 2012-01-07 (No. 21-40] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> slipping to No. 2 on the [[Top Pop Catalog Albums]] chart after spending 3 straight week a top the chart.<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/charts/2012-01-07/catalog-albums Top Pop Catalog Albums - 2012-01-07] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''</ref> Selling a total of 460,000 copies in less than 2 month in the States, Concerto was the 8th best selling album during the 2011 [[Christmas and holiday season|holiday season]].<ref name="BW-2011YE"> {{cite web |title = The Nielsen Company & Billboard’s 2011 Music Industry Report |publisher = [[Business Wire|Businesswire]].com, Jan 5, 2012 article |url = http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20120105005547/en/Nielsen-Company-Billboard’s-2011-Music-Industry-Report |accessdate =2012-01-05}}</ref>
The album entered at No. 17 on the [[UK Albums Chart]], spending the last 6 weeks of 2011 in the top 30 of the chart. With 154,800 copies sold by year end, it finished at No. 77 on the Top 100 Best Selling Albums of 2011 list. The album also topped the [[UK Classical Charts|Classical Compilation Albums Chart]] of [[The Official Charts Company|the Official Charts]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theofficialcharts.com/archive-chart/_/8/2011-12-31/ |title=Classical Artist Albums Top 40 |publisher=Theofficialcharts.com |date=2011-12-31 |accessdate=2012-01-12}}</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=October 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox music festival | name =Deeply Vale Festivals | image = | caption = | location =[[Bury, Greater Manchester|Bury]] in northwest England | years_active =1976–1979, 1980, 1981, 2015, 2016 | founders =Chris Hewitt | dates = | genre = [[Punk rock]], rock music | attendance =20,000+ | capacity = | website =[http://www.deeplyvale.com/ Deeply Vale Festival] }}{{Essay-like|date=February 2018}}
The '''Deeply Vale Festivals''' were unique [[free festival]]s held near [[Bury, Greater Manchester|Bury]] in northwest England in 1976, 1977, 1978 and 1979 and at a different site in 1980 and 1981 They are regarded as significant events that united [[punk rock|punk]] music into the festival scene. Anniversary festivals took place in March 2015 and September 2016 (two days).
==History==
===1970s=== In the 1970s [[Rochdale]] resident and associate of [[John Peel]] (through his links with the band Tractor) Chris Hewitt was one of the main organisers of the event between 1976 and 1978 along with residents of a commune further up Oldham Road in Rochdale. Hewitt's inspiration for Deeply Vale Festivals was partly triggered working on [[Bickershaw Festival]] with [[Jeremy Beadle]] in 1972 and an event at [[Rivington Pike]] in August 1976. Chris went on to produce many other festivals and concerts and start a record company [[Ozit/Dandelion Records]].
===Deeply Vale 1976–79=== Starting with an audience of 300 camping for two days in 1976 watching space rockers Body and John Peel favourites [[Tractor (band)|Tractor]], the festival grew to 3,000 in 1977 (bands including [[Andy McCluskey]]'s Pegasus, a forerunner of [[Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark|OMD]] in 1977). By 1978 and 1979 there were 20,000 people watching bands and camping for six days.
The [[Home Office]]-sponsored body that reported on many pop festivals from the mid-1970s – [[Festival Welfare Services]] – said in a report on the 1978 that the 20,000 people event at Deeply Vale Festival "was actually better organised than the large [[Bob Dylan]] concert at [[Blackbushe]] the same summer"; "In fact in 1978 it was a model for how festivals should be run". It was the biggest free festival in England ending its annual run in the valley of Deeply Vale after four years in 1979.<ref>{{cite news | first=Mark | last=Brown | title=Stiff competition for summer's hot tickets | date=17 April 2006 | work =[[The Guardian]]| url =https://www.theguardian.com/frontpage/story/0,,1755284,00.html | accessdate = 9 September 2007 }}</ref>
As with the 1970s festivals, Deeply Vale hoped to bring together music of all styles, to create new styles and genres and maybe break a few. Since music seems to follow trends set in history by names such as [[the Beatles]], [[the Kinks]], Bob Dylan, the [[Rolling Stones]], [[the Doors]] and many others who broke the musical mould of the 1950s and 1960s turning the times into a psychedelic outlook on life. Deeply Vale has been credited as a catalyst for many bands who have formed since the 1970s festivals. Amongst people who claim to have been in the audience and inspired to pursue a musical career include [[Andy Rourke]] of [[The Smiths]], [[David Gedge]] from [[the Wedding Present]], Dave Fielding, [[Mark Burgess (musician)|Mark Burgess]] and Reg Smithies from [[the Chameleons]], [[Jimi Goodwin]] from the [[Doves (band)|Doves]], [[Boff Whalley]] from Chumbawamba Steve Cowen from the [[Mock Turtles]] and [[Ian Brown]] from [[the Stone Roses]].<ref>{{cite news | first=Paul | last=Taylor | title=Rock'n'roll Rochdale | date=19 November 2004 | work =[[Manchester Evening News]]| url =http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/entertainment/film_and_tv/s/137/137475_rocknroll_rochdale.html | accessdate = 9 September 2007 }}</ref>
The Deeply Vale Festivals were the first of the hippie music festivals to mix punk bands on the bill in amongst festival stalwarts<ref>{{cite news | first=Andrew | last=Cowen | title=The Birmingham Post: Perspective: Truly, madly, Deeply Vale | date=14 August 2004 | work =[[Birmingham Post]]| url =http://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_ver=z39.88-2004&rft_id=info:sid/iw.newsbank.com:AWNB:BPOC&rft_val_format=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:ctx&rft_dat=10488E68EF5F767D&svc_dat=InfoWeb:aggregated4&req_dat=0D0CB57AB53DF815 | accessdate = 9 September 2007 }}</ref> like [[Steve Hillage]], [[Nik Turner]], [[the Ruts]], [[Misty in Roots]], [[Tractor (band)|Tractor]] (who had already achieved some notoriety as a [[John Peel]] band), [[Here & Now (band)|Here and Now]] and [[The Fall (band)|The Fall]].
[[The Fall (band)|The Fall]] were regulars at the festival at a young age (and [[Mark E. Smith]] held the event in high esteem), and [[Durutti Column]] played their fourth ever gig on the Deeply Vale Festival stage. Both these bands were introduced by a young [[Tony Wilson]] who had just started his own record company and offered to help his friend Chris Hewitt by appearing at Deeply Vale in 1978.
The festival resumed on a smaller scale at Pickup Bank (Edgworth/Darwen) in 1980 and 1981.
===Recognition 2009=== In September 2009, two buildings associated with Deeply Vale Festivals, [[Factory Records]], Tractor and John Peel – one building formerly Tractor Sound Studios in [[Heywood, Greater Manchester|Heywood]] and one in Rochdale Tractor Music / Cargo Studios – had blue plaques unveiled to commemorate the important part the buildings played in the genealogy of rock music. The blue plaques campaign was put together by [[Peter Hook]] and Chris Hewitt.
===''Truly, Madly, Deeply Vale''=== {{See also|Truly, Madly, Deeply Vale}} Luke Bainbridge (journalist and editor of the ''Observer Music Monthly'' and attendee of Deeply Vale Festivals as a youngster) said in the 2004 ITV documentary ''[[Truly, Madly, Deeply Vale]]'' that the festivals were far more organised than Glastonbury by 1978. In July 2007 the DVD ''Deeply Vale Festivals'' was released. It contains 3 hours 40 minutes of archive band performances and interviews and the 49-minute ''Truly, Madly, Deeply Vale'' film plus other rare interviews, crowd footage and band performances.
===Festivals book===
A 272-page A4 book tracing the history of the four festivals in the Deeply Vale valley 1976/77/78/79, the two (Deeply Vale 1980 and 1981) festivals at Pickup Bank, the Rivington Pike Free Festivals 1976 and 1977, and the Manchester 1978 Rock Against Racism concerts was released in October 2014. The book came in a box set and contained eight hours of Deeply Vale related music spread over 6 CDs.
=== Deeply Vale 2015 === Following the release of the documentary, there were plans to resurrect the festival in this century. One idea was to merge with relaunching the [[Bickershaw Festival]] to become the Deeply Vale Bickershaw Festival. In the end Deeply Vale happened again after the release of the 2014 box set.
On 20 March 2015, Deeply Vale Festival 2015 took place in Heywood with Steve Hillage, with Mark E Smith from The Fall there to watch him, plus other performances from Notsensibles, Nik Turner, Segs from The Ruts, Victor Brox, George Borowski, Andy T, Graham Massey and Graham Clark, Andy Sharrocks and Accident on the East Lancs, Wilful Damage, Physical Wrecks, Movement Banned and Brian Eastwood and Pie.
=== Deeply Vale 2016 === To mark the 40th anniversary of the first year of Deeply Vale 1976, on Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 September 2016 a festival was held at the Heywood Civic Centre in Heywood, including appearances by many of the artists who had played the original festivals: Steve Hillage, members of Here and Now and Gong, Nik Turner, Segs from The Ruts, The Drones, Victor Brox, Andy T, Mike Sweeney and the Salford Jets, Fast Cars, Andy Sharrocks and Accident on the East Lancs, Wilful Damage, Physical Wrecks, George Borowski and Gaynor Wilson with Jaki Windmill, Andy Bole, Potential Victims, Crude Oil Inc, Alchemist, Mudanzas and loads more. The festival weekend was captured on film and released as a beautiful artworked 3 DVD set.

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{use New Zealand English|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific-prefix = Councillor |name = Deon Swiggs |honorific-suffix = |image = Deon_Swiggs_in_Council_Chamber.jpg |imagesize = |alt = |caption = Swiggs in Christchurch City Council chamber |order = |office = Councillor for the Central Ward |term_start = 8 October 2016 |term_end = present |deputy = |predecessor = Ward established |constituency = |majority = |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|9|6}} |birth_place = [[Nelson, New Zealand]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = New Zealand |party = Labour Party (until early 2016) |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = |profession = |religion = |signature = |signature_alt= |website = deonswiggs.com }}
[[File:Deon Swiggs at AMI Stadium.jpg|thumb|Deon Swiggs at AMI Stadium]]
'''Deon William Swiggs''' (born 6 September 1986, [[Nelson, New Zealand]]) is the Christchurch City Councillor representing the Central ward. Prior to Swiggs being elected, he was most well known for his participation in Rebuild Christchurch, an organisation founded after the [[2010 Canterbury earthquake]].
== 1986–2015 == [[File:DeonSwiggsPrinceCharles.jpg|thumb|Deon Swiggs meets Prince Charles in Christchurch]] Swiggs was born in Nelson, New Zealand and is the oldest of 3 siblings. Until Swiggs was 5, he was raised at [[Parihaka|Parihaka Pa]] as a Christian. Swiggs was educated at [[Marlborough Boys' College]] where he was a [[sixth form]] [[prefect]]. After graduating in 2004, Swiggs joined the [[Royal New Zealand Navy]] in 2005 as a navigation officer. Swiggs left the Navy in 2008 to pursue a career in the business sector.<ref name="about me">{{cite web |last=Swiggs |first=Deon |title=Deon Swiggs: About |url= http://deonswiggs.com/about/ |accessdate=6 September 2013}}</ref> In 2008, Swiggs worked as a [[real estate]] agent for Harcourts in New Plymouth before transferring to Christchurch in 2009. He left the company in 2010 to form Swiggs Consulting Limited. Later in 2010, Swiggs was offered the position of South Island Accounts Manager at AdzUp.<ref name="about me" />
At the time of the [[2010 Canterbury earthquake]], Swiggs was working for AdzUp, two days later he founded Rebuild Christchurch, which collated information from a variety of sources and placed this information in an easy to understand format. Swiggs has been called one of the innovate new entrepreneurs born out of the Christchurch earthquakes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Entrepreneurs emerge from Chch quake|url=http://www.3news.co.nz/Entrepreneurs-emerge-from-Chch-quake/tabid/423/articleID/299853/Default.aspx#ixzz2YdpjgSMi|publisher=3news.co.uk|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> On 22 February 2011, Swiggs was in the AdzUp office located in the Christchurch CBD when the first earthquake struck,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/world_now/2012/02/new-zealand-earthquake-hard-to-move-on-when-ground-keeps-moving.html |title=New Zealand earthquake: Hard to move on when ground keeps moving |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=22 February 2012 |accessdate=6 September 2013}}</ref> he left the building he was in, and helped other people with the aftermath of the earthquake.{{citation needed|date=September 2013}}
In April 2011, Swiggs was made redundant from AdzUp due to the earthquakes. From this time, Swiggs worked full-time on RebuildChristchurch.co.nz and studied on the side.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.3news.co.nz/Entrepreneurs-emerge-from-Chch-quake/tabid/423/articleID/299853/Default.aspx |title=Entrepreneurs emerge from Chch quake – Story – NZ News |publisher=3 News |date= |accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> In 2012, Swiggs was nominated for Young New Zealander of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|title=CPIT Student in the Business of Recovery|url=http://www.cpit.ac.nz/news-and-events/news/cpit-student-in-the-business-of-recovery|publisher=Cpit.ac.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> and was named alongside [[Roger Sutton]] and [[Bob Parker (mayor)|Bob Parker]] as a leader in the Canterbury Rebuild.
Swiggs was accepted into a placement at the Christchurch Polytechnic Institute of Technology in February 2013 into a Bachelor of Applied Management. In March 2013, Swiggs Graduated from CPIT with Bachelor of Applied Management Majoring in Sales and Marketing <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/8127366/Student-numbers-up-in-line-with-rebuild |title=Student numbers up in line with rebuild – Story – NZ News |publisher=The Press |date= |accessdate=11 September 2012}}</ref> and Graduate Diploma in Innovation and Entrepreneurship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/8127366/Student-numbers-up-in-line-with-rebuild |title=Student numbers up in line with rebuild – Story – NZ News |publisher=The Press |date= |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> ''The Press'' reported on 27 April 2013 that Swiggs was contemplating running for Councillor of the [[Christchurch City Council]].<ref>{{cite news|title=The Press Campaigners set their sights on council seats|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/8602859/Campaigners-set-their-sights-on-council-seats|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref>
On 26 August 2013, Swiggs announced he had put his nomination forward for the [[Christchurch East by-election, 2013|Christchurch East by-election]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Rachel Young |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/the-east/9085151/Deon-Swiggs-to-challenge-Dalziel-seat |title=Deon Swiggs To Stand for Dalziel's Christchurch... |publisher=Stuff.co.nz |date= |accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> On 22 September 2013 Swiggs found his nomination was unsuccessful. Poto Williams was selected and elected Member of Parliament.<ref>{{cite web|title=Poto Williams selected as Labour Christchurch East Candidate|url=http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/PA1309/S00398/poto-williams-selected-as-labour-christchurch-east-candidate.htm|website=Scoop.co.nz|accessdate=29 July 2015}}</ref>
In July 2015, Swiggs and Christchurch broadcaster Chris Lynch along with award-winning film maker [[Gerard Smyth]] spent a week interviewing various citizens of Christchurch about their views on the Christchurch Earthquake Recovery Act draft transition recovery plan, which expired in April 2016. As of 28 July, the video has been watched more than 30,000 times.<ref>{{cite web|last1=MEIER|first1=CECILE|title='Huge wave of support' for locally-led recovery|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/business/the-rebuild/70626210/huge-wave-of-support-for-locallyled-recovery|website=The Press|publisher=Fairfax Media}}</ref>
==Present== Presently, Swiggs is the chair of The Rebuild Build Christchurch Foundation, director of Rebuild Christchurch, and a founding trustee on the Canterbury Insurance Advocacy Service funded by council to advocate for people with insurance issues.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://canterburyinsuranceadvocacyservice.wordpress.com/who-we-are-2/|title=Canterbury Insurance Advocacy Service |publisher=Canterburyinsuranceadvocacyservice.wordpress.com |accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref>
On 31 May 2016, Swiggs announced that he would stand for [[Christchurch City Council]] as an independent in the newly created Christchurch Central ward in the [[New Zealand local elections, 2016|2016 local body elections]]. On 8 October 2016, he was elected to the council.<ref>https://www.ccc.govt.nz/assets/Documents/The-Council/How-the-Council-works/2016elections/Christchurch-City-Council-2016-Triennial-Elections-Final-FPP-Result-with-elected-unopposed.pdf</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/80586937/rebuild-christchurch-founder-deon-swiggs-standing-for-council/ |title=Rebuild Christchurch founder Deon Swiggs standing for council | work=[[The Press]] |accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref>
== Projects == Swiggs has worked on the following projects;
* Project Christmas<ref>{{cite news|title=Struggling Families Given A Boost|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/8113938/Struggling-families-given-a-boost|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/8106760/Bus-makes-special-deliveries|title=Stuff | Bus Makes Special Deliveries|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * Lets Get It Done<ref>{{cite news|title=Stuff | Getting it Done|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/christchurch-earthquake-2011/6482677/Getting-more-of-it-done|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * Football in the Gap<ref>{{cite news|title=Rebuild Christchurch | Football in the Gap|publisher=Rebuild Christchurch|url=http://www.rebuildchristchurch.co.nz/blog/2012/10/football-in-the-gap|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * The Canterbury Insurance Assistance Service<ref>{{cite news |title=Fairfax|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/politics/9140390/Six-seek-Lianne-Dalziels-Labour-spot|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> * Buck Brings Back Marmite<ref>{{cite news|title=Sanitarium | Buck Brings Back Marmite|url=http://www.sanitarium.co.nz/about-us/sanitarium-news/2013/buck-brings-back-marmite|publisher=Sanitarium|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * A Beautiful Struggle<ref>{{cite news |title=Newstalk ZB|url=http://www.newstalkzb.co.nz/auckland/news/nbent/1613229383-marmite-photos-make-money-for-christchurch|publisher=Newstalkzb.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * Christchurch Panoramas<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11449319 | title=New pics illustrate change in Christchurch's cityscape |work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=The Press|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/68613289/aerial-views-of-christchurch-prove-popular}}</ref> * Eyes East <ref>{{cite news |title=The Press|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/christchurch-life/72351083/CTV-to-debut-doco-series-on-East-Christchurch}}</ref>
== Personal life == Swiggs is the first openly out Christchurch councilor who supports the LGBTIQ generously. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170423044601/http://www.gaynz.com/articles/publish/2/article_18855.php|title=GayNZ.com Chch elects openly gay councillor, Deon Swiggs|date=23 April 2017|access-date=7 February 2018}}</ref>
==Awards== * Local Hero Award in New Zealander of the Year Awards <ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite news|title=CPIT student in the business of recovery|url=http://www.cpit.ac.nz/news-and-events/items?a=137952|newspaper=CPIT News|publisher=Cpit.ac.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * Christchurch City Council Service Award for Youth <ref name="autogenerated1"/> * Community Service Award <ref>{{cite news|title=Awards for those who donate their time|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/news/7125245/Awards-for-those-who-donate-their-time|newspaper=[[The Press]] |publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref>
